category.name: Design
category.description: Master design principles, user experience, and visual communication skills.

sub_categories.name: UI/UX Design
sub_categories.description: Learn user interface and user experience design principles and best practices.

exercises.title: Design Systems & Architecture
exercises.description: Design and implement comprehensive design systems and scalable UI architectures.

tasks.title: Design Token System
tasks.question:
Create a comprehensive design token system using CSS custom properties.

Your system should:

  • Define color, typography, spacing, and component tokens
  • Support light and dark themes
  • Include semantic naming conventions
  • Provide documentation and usage examples
  • Support responsive design breakpoints
tasks.hint: Use CSS custom properties with semantic naming, organize by category, and include theme switching
tasks.input: Design tokens for colors, typography, spacing, and breakpoints
tasks.output: Complete design token system with theme support and documentation

tasks.title: Design Token Benefits
tasks.question:
What is the primary benefit of using design tokens in a design system?

Consider: How design tokens improve consistency and maintainability
tasks.hint: Think about centralized design values and consistency across components
options: Centralized design values - consistency and maintainability

tasks.title: Component Library Architecture
tasks.question:
Design a scalable component library architecture with proper abstraction layers.

Your architecture should:

  • Separate primitive, composite, and page-level components
  • Implement proper prop interfaces and TypeScript types
  • Include component documentation and storybook integration
  • Support composition and inheritance patterns
  • Provide testing utilities and examples
tasks.hint: Use atomic design principles, TypeScript interfaces, and proper component composition
tasks.input: Component library with Button, Card, Modal, and Page components
tasks.output: Scalable component architecture with documentation and testing

exercises.title: Advanced UX Research & Analytics
exercises.description: Implement advanced user research methodologies and analytics systems.

tasks.title: User Behavior Analytics
tasks.question:
Implement a comprehensive user behavior analytics system.

Your system should:

  • Track user interactions, scroll depth, and time on page
  • Monitor conversion funnels and drop-off points
  • Collect heatmap data and click tracking
  • Provide real-time dashboards and insights
  • Support data export and integration with external tools
tasks.hint: Use Intersection Observer for scroll tracking, event listeners for interactions, and localStorage for data storage
tasks.input: Analytics system for e-commerce product page
tasks.output: Complete analytics system with real-time tracking and insights dashboard

tasks.title: Heatmap Analysis
tasks.question:
What type of user behavior data do heatmaps primarily visualize?

Consider: How heatmaps represent user interaction patterns
tasks.hint: Think about visual representation of user activity on a page
options: Click patterns and scroll behavior - user interaction

tasks.title: User Journey Analytics
tasks.question:
Create a user journey tracking and analysis system.

Your system should:

  • Track user paths through the application
  • Identify common user flows and pain points
  • Measure time spent at each step
  • Detect abandonment patterns and reasons
  • Generate journey optimization recommendations
tasks.hint: Use session storage for journey tracking, timestamps for duration, and pattern analysis for insights
tasks.input: User journey tracking for signup flow
tasks.output: Complete journey analytics with optimization recommendations
